dialogue.text: In the mirror, I see my mother's eyes, my father's nose, ancestors I never met. 'What am I?' includes all of them, yet exceeds their sum.
Daddy, why do I have great-grandma's chin but my own thoughts?
We're evolving. Not just culturally but neurologically. The practice of questioning identity may be driving human consciousness toward greater complexity.
He studies how questions change our brains!
ARIA asks the same question without genes. Perhaps consciousness itself, not genetics, drives the questioning.
Daddy, will my children wonder what they are too?
Probably. But they might wonder in ways we can't imagine.

visual_elements.brain_scans: Neural pathways of questioners vs resisters

psychological_notes: Explores how existential questioning might create heritable changes in neurology and consciousness. Shows the question as both genetic inheritance and transcendent property. Yuki represents generation for whom questioning is biological and cultural birthright.
philosophical_underpinning: Consciousness exceeds its material components while including them
therapeutic_direction: Understanding identity as river flowing through generations
